IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: IMPROVE STUDENT SUCCESS AND PREPARE AN EDUCATED WORKFORCE THROUGH PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO RAISE PRIVATE PHILANTHROPIC GIFTS THAT SUPPORT NEEDS OF STUDENTS AND FACULTY, IMPROVE STUDENT SUCCESS AND HELP TO PREPARE AN EDUCATED WORKFORCE BY PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND EMERGENCY GRANTS TO STUDENTS AS WELL AS COLLEGE PROGRAM SUPPORT.
IRS990.Desc: DIRECT STUDENT SUPPORT WAS ESPECIALLY CRITICAL TO KEEP STUDENTS IN SCHOOL AND SUCCEEDING AS THEY RECOVER FROM THE EFFECTS OF THE PANDEMIC. THE STUDENT EMERGENCY FUND ASSISTED WITH BASIC NEEDS, HOUSING AND FOOD INSECURITY. SCHOLARSHIPS PROVIDED BY GENEROUS INDIVIDUALS, CORPORATIONS, FOUNDATIONS AND EMPLOYEES WAS AWARDED TO 601 STUDENTS IN THE FOUR LOS RIOS COLLEGES. SCHOLARSHIPS COVER TUITION FEES, TEXTBOOKS, TRANSPORTATION AND LIVING EXPENSES FOR STUDENTS WITH A HIGH LEVEL OF FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THE LOS RIOS SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM SUPPORTS DESERVING STUDENTS INCLUDING FOSTER YOUTH, VETERANS, SINGLE PARENTS AND AT-RISK LOW INCOME POPULATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES FOUNDATION PROVIDED SUPPORT TO COLLEGEDEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS DURING THE 2021-22 ACADEMIC YEAR. THESE RESOURCES ALLOW COLLEGE FACULTY, STAFF AND ADMINISTRATORS TO IMPROVE EXISTING PROGRAMS, EXPERIMENT WITH NEW AND INNOVATIVE APPROACHES AND SUPPORT STUDENT SUCCESS. THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES FOUNDATION PROVIDES PHILANTHROPIC SUPPORT TO THE FOUR LOS RIOS COLLEGES, AMERICAN RIVER, COSUMNES RIVER, FOLSOM LAKE AND SACRAMENTO CITY, AND THE HARRIS CENTER FOR THE ARTS, BY SERVING AS THE VEHICLE THROUGH WHICH INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS MAY INVEST IN THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES AND THEIR STUDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THANKS TO GENEROUS CORPORATE AND INDIVIDUAL DONORS, LRCF CONTINUED TO REMOVE BARRIERS FOR STUDENTS THROUGH THE PROMISE INITIATIVE. THE LOS RIOS PROMISE SCHOLARSHIPS PROVIDED $500 AWARDS TO FIRST TIME, FULL TIME STUDENTS WITH HIGH FINANCIAL NEED. THIS YEAR WE LAUNCHED THE PROMISE TO CAREER CONSTRUCTION PROGRAM TO HELP PREPARE STUDENTS FOR HIGH-PAYING, HIGH-QUALITY JOBS IN THE CONSTRUCTION AND BUILDING INDUSTRY AND MEET THE DEMAND IN THE REGION FOR SKILLED WORKERS. STUDENTS RECEIVED ENROLLMENT AND COMPLETION SCHOLARSHIPS TO HELP WITH NEEDS SUCH AS WORK BOOTS, TOOLS AND SAFETY GLASSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES FOUNDATION RECEIVES GIFTS OF REAL ESTATE, GOODS AND EQUIPMENT IN SUPPORT OF ACADEMIC AND STUDENT PROGRAMS. GIFTS THIS YEAR INCLUDED ITEMS THAT PROVIDED REAL WORLD, HANDS ON OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR STUDENTS SUCH AS BATTERY STORAGE AND ENERGY MONITORING STATIONS TO BENEFIT THE SOLAR INSTALLERS PROGRAM, SCIENCE KITS TO BENEFIT VITICULTURE AND CHEMISTRY PROGRAMS, AND TWO COMPLETE AIRPLANE ENGINES AND A PROPELLER TO BENEFIT THE AERONATICS PROGRAM. MANY OF THESE GIFTS COME FROM GENEROUS INDUSTRY PARTNERS WHO BENEFIT FROM HIRING THE SKILLED EMPLOYEES WHO RECEIVE THEIR EDUCATION AT THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VARIOUS ENDOWED FUNDS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS, GENERAL DEPARTMENT AND PROGRAM SUPPORT, EQUIPMENT PURCHASES, CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS AND FACULTY RESEARCH AND TEACHING ACTIVITIES.

MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THE FOUNDATION HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT OF ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AFFECTING ITS FILING REQUIREMENTS, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION WOULD RECOGNIZE FUTURE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AND LIABILITIES IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE IF SUCH INTEREST AND PENALTIES ARE INCURRED.

EACH SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT HAS ITS OWN CRITERIA TO IDENTIFY QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS AS DETERMINED BY THE DONORS AND SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BY A COMMITTEE USING THIS CRITERIA. THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES FOUNDATION MAINTAINS RECORDS OF AMOUNTS GIVEN TO STUDENTS AND ENCOURAGES STUDENTS TO THANK THEIR DONORS THROUGH LETTERS AND PICTURES.
THE NUMBER INDICATES THE NUMBER OF DONORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION BOARD'S FINANCE COMMITTEE RECEIVES AND REVIEWS A DRAFT OF THE 990 PRIOR TO A FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETING WHERE QUESTIONS ARE DISCUSSED AND ANY SUGGESTIONS TO THE 990 ARE MADE. THE COMMITTEE THEN REPORTS TO THE FULL FOUNDATION BOARD AT THE NEXT GENERAL BOARD MEETING ABOUT THEIR REVIEW AND THE BOARD RECEIVES AND APPROVES A FINAL COPY OF THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE LOS RIOS COLLEGES FOUNDATION REQUIRES ITS MEMBERS TO SIGN THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
